pageContext.description: Typology: Septum thickens to blade at non-diffuse bevel,Condition: corrosion notch at butt; blade tips slightly squashed
pageContext.surface: pale green, dry surface with numerous small pocks - some containing powdery light green; generally worn appearance
pageContext.other: Oh dear - I have been putting "half"-flanged, but this one is clearly "haft"-flanged - sorry if the others were too. Must only have been using haft a brain. Top left of card (NGR box) says "SU 320", and the, on the next line, aligned below "320" is "763" - grid reference? I added England to the address to be consistent. I transcribed Circumstances into Site field and Typology & Condition into Description field. There is some additional info bottom right: PIF "sketch over"; Rec. "SN Aug 93"; Source "Sb.A"; Sub-Inf. "P. Cannon - Newbury M". On Diagram is written "sketch only 1:1")
